title: Introduction to Objects
description: Learn what objects are and how to store structured data using key-value pairs.

steps.content:
## ðŸ”¹ What Is an Object?
An **object** is a collection of related data.

While an array stores a list `['red', 'blue']`, an object stores data with **labels** (keys).

```javascript
const car = {
    brand: 'Tesla',
    model: 'Model 3',
    year: 2023
};
```
Here, `brand`, `model`, and `year` are **keys**, and `'Tesla'`, `'Model 3'`, `2023` are **values**.

title: Accessing & Modifying
description: Learn how to read and change values inside an object.

steps.content:
## ðŸ”¹ Accessing Properties
There are two ways to access data:

### 1. Dot Notation (Most Common)
```javascript
console.log(car.brand); // 'Tesla'
```

### 2. Bracket Notation
Useful if the key has spaces or is stored in a variable.
```javascript
console.log(car['model']); // 'Model 3'
```

## ðŸ”¹ Modifying Properties
You can change values or add new ones:
```javascript
car.year = 2024; // Update
car.color = 'Red'; // Add new
```
